com.bytelightning.opensource.pokerface

Class RequestForScriptConsumer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bytelightning.opensource.pokerface.AbsClientRequestConsumer
      • com.bytelightning.opensource.pokerface.RequestForScriptConsumer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, org.apache.http.nio.protocol.HttpAsyncRequestConsumer<ResponseProducer>

    public class RequestForScriptConsumer
extends AbsClientRequestConsumer
    Specialization of AbsClientRequestConsumer to consume a client request that will be processed by a JavaScript endpoint.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.bytelightning.opensource.pokerface.AbsClientRequestConsumer

        buffer, context, Logger, producer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      This specialization currently does nothing.
      void requestReceived(org.apache.http.HttpRequest request)
      Since the RequestHandler already asked the endpoint to evaluate the request, *and* since the scripts don't currently perform async loading of request content, this method does nothing.

      • Methods inherited from class com.bytelightning.opensource.pokerface.AbsClientRequestConsumer

        consumeContent, failed, getException, getResult, isDone, requestCompleted

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • requestReceived

        public void requestReceived(org.apache.http.HttpRequest request)
                     throws org.apache.http.HttpException,
                            IOException
        Since the RequestHandler already asked the endpoint to evaluate the request, *and* since the scripts don't currently perform async loading of request content, this method does nothing.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        This specialization currently does nothing. The producer does not need our buffer, so this method closes it.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
